word_mean: 晒黑，晒成褐色：因接触阳光或紫外线而使皮肤变黑或变褐
这是由于皮肤里原有的黑色素颜色加深(Meirowsky现象)、新黑色素加速形成以及角化迟延致使黑色素滞留于表皮等原因

sentence.Network_en: With almost evangelical fervour, Marks warns against deliberately seeking a tan.
sentence.Network_cn: 几乎是凭着一股疯狂的热情，马克斯警告人们不要刻意追求晒成一身古铜色。

sentence.Network_en: Leigh rolled over on her stomach to tan her back.
sentence.Network_cn: 莉翻了个身趴下，开始晒后背。

sentence.Network_en: She is tall and blonde, with a permanent tan.
sentence.Network_cn: 她高个儿，一头金发，皮肤黝黑。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English tannian 'convert into leather', probably from medieval Latin tannare, perhaps of Celtic origin; reinforced in Middle English by Old French tanner. Early use of the noun (late Middle English) was in sense 2

entry.def: If you have a tan, your skin has become darker than usual because you have been in the sun.

example.ex: She is tall and blonde, with a permanent tan.
example.tran: 她高个儿，一头金发，皮肤黝黑。

entry.def: If a part of your body tans or if you tan it, your skin becomes darker than usual because you spend a lot of time in the sun.

example.ex: I have very pale skin that never tans...
example.tran: 我皮肤很白，怎么也晒不黑。

entry.def: Something that is tan is a light brown colour.
To tan animal skins means to make them into leather by treating them with tannin or other chemicals.

means.word_mean: 1. a browning of the skin resulting from exposure to the rays of the sun
3. ratio of the opposite to the adjacent side of a right-angled triangle
1. treat skins and hides with tannic acid so as to convert them into leather
2. get a tan, from wind or sun

sentences.en: These shoes are tan, not dark brown.
sentences.cn: 这些鞋是棕黄色的, 不是深褐色的。

sentences.en: She tanned quickly in the sun.
sentences.cn: 她在太阳下很快晒黑了。

sentences.en: It's small wonder you got tanned, staying out in the sun all that time.
sentences.cn: 你老是暴露在太阳底下, 难怪晒得那么黑。

sentences.en: Tanners tan hides to make leather shoes.

jushi.english: Sun and wind had tanned the sailor's face.
